intro: Woodia mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved woodia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are often elliptical in shape. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers are clustered in umbels, and it produces small, round berries that are edible. Woodia mucronata is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
